messages.message:
Alright, I don’t think my go fix worked. :cry: I think I just got lucky and didn’t end up with a negative serial number in the cert the few times I tested it.

@William Helmrath did you end up finding any better solution when you were looking at this?

I paused my investigation when you merged your PR but I’ll keep looking into it - my two guesses are:
1. We can pass in `GODEBUG=x509negativeserial=1` as an CLI arg to the db tests
2. Figuring out where the negative serial numbers coming from (i don’t think it’s hard-coded bc these tests are flaky) and update them so they’re always positive
Yeah sorry, I thought I had it, but definitely just got lucky. It's cropping up randomly still. :disappointed:
I think I have a fix though!
The fix is: Turn off TLS when testing sqlserver :slightly_smiling_face: seems to have worked!
Interesting - I thought I was seeing the errors crop up for postgres specifically but maybe I was misreading the logs
A big challenge with this bug is not being able to re-create the CI environment. I don’t know how to reproduce these errors in Crafting
So, it was intermittent even in CI. The issue is that the sqlserver docker container we're using _sometimes_ starts up with a cert that has a negative number in it.
Reproducing it involved running `ib start sqlserver` (run some tests) `ib stop sqlserver` in a loop until it happened again...this is an odd one though.
